name: DOT-31608-FUL-QAC-ITP-011 - Topsoil Placement and Landscaping
template name: DOT-31608-FUL-QAC-ITP-011 - Topsoil Placement and Landscaping Rev 0

name: 1.1 - Check that current revision drawings are being used
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Refer to latest drawings and latest available revision used
REFERENCE DOCUMENTS: IFC Project Drawings/ Drawing Register
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: Latest Revision Drawings
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Samples, records and certificates shall be provided to the Superintendent at least 10 working days prior to bulk delivery.
Following information shall be provided to the superintendent:
— Plant stock for all plant species
— Evidence of origin of indigenous provenance plant material
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Site mulch available from the chipping of on-site indigenous or non-weed vegetation shall be used where possible.
○ All wood mulch shall be supplied, delivered, handled and applied in accordance with AS 4454, and shall comply with Table 720.044
REFERENCE DOCUMENTS: VicRoads Standard Section 720.04, VicRoads Standard Table 720.044 AS4454
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed off
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Site topsoil shall be used wherever possible, in preference to imported topsoil.
○ Where imported topsoil is used, the topsoil must conform to the properties specified in Table 720.042
REFERENCE DOCUMENTS: VicRoads Standard Section 720.04, VicRoads Standard Table 720.042
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed off
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Planting areas are to be set out to the location and shape specified in the landscape drawings.
○ Plant density requirements and planting offsets established in the plant schedule are to be adhered to.
○ Plants shall be placed as shown on the drawings.
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed off
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Soil preparation shall be in accordance with Table 720.071
REFERENCE DOCUMENTS: VicRoads Standard Section 720.07, VicRoads Standard Table 720.071
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed off
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: All ripping works shall conform to the requirements of Cl 720.07 (b).

○ Ripped areas of planting, individual tree planting and grassing are to be made available for inspection prior to mulching, planting or grassing, and shall not proceed until the Superintendent acknowledges requirements for ripping have been met.
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed off
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: All disturbed and/or not paved areas shall be topsoiled according to Section 204 of VicRoads Standard for Roadworks and Bridge works, to the following minimum depths:
— Tree and shrub plantation bed areas = 100mm
— Verge, 50mm outer edge / 20mm when within 100mm of the edge of seal or asphalt surface treatment
○ Following subsoil preparation, topsoil shall be spread on planting areas and grassed areas. Topsoil shall not be compacted.
REFERENCE DOCUMENTS: Project Spec. Cl.3020.07(k), VicRoads Standard Section 204.17, VicRoads Standard Section 720.07
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Cultivation shall be undertaken to break soil down to a tilth with 80% of the volume composed of clods less than 50 mm in diameter
○ Prior to mulching, planting or grassing, area to be presented to Superintendent for approval.
○ In areas where topsoiling or cultivation is not practicable, the Contractor shall submit alternative methods to achieve an equivalent result to the Superintendent for review.
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed off
2.6 - Bulk density of soils for planting and grassing
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: After cultivation and trimming, the Contractor may lightly compress topsoil for stability on slopes.
○ Vibrating plates shall not be used. Ensure the dry bulk density does not exceed the limits in Table 720.072
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed off
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: The finished level of grassed areas shall be:
(i) not higher than 125 mm below weep-holes or damp-proof courses in adjacent walls;
(ii) level with the bottom of fence plinths;
(iii) level with adjacent pavements, kerbs, pits and other structures.
○ The finished level of garden bed mulch and/or topsoil shall be tapered so that the finished mulch and/or topsoil levels meet flush with the adjacent surfaces.
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed off
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Holes in heavy soils or on batters shall be prepared so as to ensure adequate drainage.
○ Planting holes shall be backfilled with friable topsoil free of debris, rocks and clods greater than 50 mm in diameter.
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed off
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Install wood mulch to all Planting Areas unless otherwise specified.

○ Mulch shall extend at least 1 metre beyond plant centres at the outer edges of all Planting Areas. If space does not permit this in median, separator or splitter-island planting, mulching shall extend to the back of kerb.
○ The Contractor shall install 2 metre diameter mulch rings around all Individual Tree Plantings.
○ Mulch depths in all situations shall be a minimum 75 mm and maximum 125 mm.
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed off
FREQUENCY: Once installation of assets completed
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: All disturbed areas shall be topsoiled and grassed, all areas to be cultivated to a minimum 50mm depth, and moistened prior to the application of grass seed and fertiliser.
○ A joint inspection of all grassed areas shall be carried out between the contractor and superintendent three months after sowing has taken place.
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Grass seed shall be sown at minimum 100 kg/Ha (if drilled) or 200 kg/Ha (if broadcast), distributed evenly to achieve an even and dense grass cover.
○ Germination rate shall be minimum 80% cover within 8 weeks and 95% cover within 3 months of sowing.
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed off
The signature below verifies that this ITP has been completed in accordance with the FH’s Quality system Procedures and verifies lot compliance with specifications.
DOT-31608-FUL-QAC-ITP-012 - Traffic Island, Median Island & Driveways
template name: DOT-31608-FUL-QAC-ITP-012 - Traffic Island, Median Island & Driveways Rev 0

name: 1.1 - Check that current revision drawings are being used
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Issued For Construction (IFC) and latest available revision used
REFERENCE DOCUMENTS: Project Drawings / Drawing Register
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: Latest Revision Drawings
FREQUENCY: Once, for each mix design, prior to placement of material
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: 20mm Class 3 bedding material conforms to specified requirements applicable to the class of product as detailed on the drawings.
○ Material is registered with VicRoads in accordance with Code of Practice RC500.02.
FREQUENCY: Once, for each mix design, prior to placement of concrete
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Concrete mix meets strength, grade, and maximum aggregate size as detailed on the drawings.
○ Paving concrete mix conforms to AS1379.
○ SUP concrete mix is registered with VicRoads.
○ No air entraining chemical admixtures shall be used without approval from the Nominated Authority.
○ Concrete mix designs shall remain valid for 12 months from the date of registration, unless constituent materials and material proportions cease to comply with the specified requirements.
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: Concrete Mix Design
FREQUENCY: Once, for each product, prior to placement of concrete
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Details of evaporative retardant, application procedure (including application rates) to be submitted for review to the Nominated Authority.
FREQUENCY: Once, for each product, prior to placement of concrete
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Details of curing compound and NATA test certificate stating compliance with AS3799 no more than 3 years from issue, to be submitted for review to the Nominated Authority.
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: Curing compound submission

ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: The Superintendent will review and confirm the set out. The work shall be constructed in accordance with the confirmed set out to the line and level and cross-sectional profiles as shown on the drawings.
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: CONQA Hold Point

ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Before obstructing any waterway, channel or culvert, the Contractor shall make appropriate provision for its temporary diversion, and obtain prior written approval from the relevant waterway authority. The Contractor shall make provision for the safe discharge of drainage and stormwater at all times during construction.
REFERENCE DOCUMENTS: IFC Drawings VicRoads Spec Cl.703.18
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: Written approval from relevant waterway authority, ITP Signed
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Where applicable, excavation to allow for increase in the bedding and slab thicknesses at:
○ Consult the Relevant Council drawings for dimensional tolerances for thicknesses, grades and ramp lengths.
REFERENCE DOCUMENTS: IFC Drawings VicRoads Spec 703.16, 703.24, Relevant Council Drawings

ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: All bedding material shall be as specified on design drawings. Where not specified, bedding material used for cast in place concrete paving works shall be compacted size 20 mm Class 3 or Class 4 crushed rock or Class 3 or Class 4 crushed concrete, manufactured and supplied in accordance with Sections 812 or 820 respectively.
○ Immediately before concrete is placed, the bedding shall be moist but shall have no free water on the surface.
REFERENCE DOCUMENTS: VicRoads Spec Cl.703.21, 812, 820 IFC Drawings
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Prior to placing concrete in an earth excavation, formwork shall be erected so that fresh concrete is not placed directly against the sides of the excavation.
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Steel reinforcement shall be placed in accordance with drawings and AS/NZS 4671. If not specified, mesh shall be placed as per VicRoads Spec Cl. 703.16.
○ The minimum cover of any steel reinforcement to the nearest concrete surface shall be 50 mm unless shown on the drawings.
○ Reinforcement shall be supported using either concrete or plastic chairs.
REFERENCE DOCUMENTS: VicRoads Spec Cl.703.13 & Cl.703.13, AS/NZS 4671
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Inspection to ensure that forms, reinforcement dowels and other embedments conform to the requirements of the specifications and drawings.
REFERENCE DOCUMENTS: VicRoads Spec Cl.703.05, Cl.703.09, Cl.610.17 (a)(b) (c)(d), AS 1379
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Concrete Testing Frequency: 0m³ to 50m³ = 1 sample
○ Each sample shall consist of 1 no. slump test and 2 no. compressive strength cylinders minimum.
○ Compressive strength cylinders = 2 no. 28 day strength.
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: Concrete Pour Record, ITP Signed

ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: The curing of exposed concrete surfaces shall commence immediately after finishing operations are progressively completed and shall continue uninterrupted for a period of not less than 7 days after placing the concrete
○ Concrete shall be cured either by water curing, wet hessian, polyethylene sheeting which is adequately sealed, curing compound or a combination of these

ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Concrete paving to match existing fixtures (e.g. pit covers, edgings and vehicle crossings) within 5mm. Deviation of finished work shall not exceed; 10mm from line or level; or 5mm from a 3m straightedge for curves and shaped areas. Deviation of section dimensions shall not exceed 5mm (except for overall width); 25mm for the overall width; and +/- 3mm for dimensions less than 25mm.
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Expansion Joints: shall be placed at intervals as specified by the drawings.

○ Control Joints: at least 25% of the paving thickness deep and 5 mm wide shall be formed with a cutting tool at 2.5 m intervals along the full width of footpaths, other surfacings and shared use paths.

○ Between Concrete Paving and Shared Use Path: Except for medians <2.0m wide, bonding between the concrete paving or shared use path and the edging shall be prevented by painting the back of the edging with bitumen, or by using a strip of bituminous felt (ableflex).
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Formwork shall not be stripped until the minimum times have elapsed from the time of completion of the placing of concrete:
i. 2 days for vertical formwork on external surfaces; and
ii. 1 day for vertical forms on permanently hidden surfaces
REFERENCE DOCUMENTS: VicRoads Spec 703.12, AS3610 Table C2
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: All concrete shall be protected from damage from early loading by pedestrians, animals, vehicles and from rain or any other cause.

○ Suitable flagging, signage or bunding shall be erected to prevent vehicles from crossing over residential and/or commercial vehicle crossings a minimum of four days after completion of casting of the concrete. Vehicles greater than 1.5 tonnes may be permitted to cross after 7 days.
3.1 - Survey data captured for as-built purposes

ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Survey to ensure and validate that all works meet level and location requirements. Review of existing survey control marks and any additional control marks providing verification of conformity of as constructed features with design. As built survey recorded to confirm installation within tolerances in the latest IFC drawings.
REFERENCE DOCUMENTS: IFC Drawings / survey records
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: As-built survey records

ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: The concrete shall have no surface cracks at any stage after construction of width greater than 0.2 mm. Cracked sections of concrete shall be either removed and replaced, or repaired in accordance with Section 687
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: 28 day compressive strength (average of the 2 no. cylinders) per sample comply with the design strength.
○ Note: 1 of the 2 no. 28 day cylinders per sample may be as low as 90% of the required strength, so long as the average meets the required strength.
REFERENCE DOCUMENTS: IFC Drawings, Relevant Council Drawings 703.11 Table 703.111
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: Attach: Compressive Strength Test Results

ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Where required, as soon as concrete has cured sufficiently and not earlier than three days after placing, topsoil shall be placed and firmly compacted in layers not exceeding 150mm and to a width not less than 300mm behind the edging to the top of the edging.
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Provide record of dimensional measurements to demonstrate that all Works meet level and location requirements within the tolerances below:
○ Rate of change of deviation from RL or alignment = 10mm in 10m
○ Where median surfacings are to be constructed between edge sections of the same level, paving shall be crowned to produce a crossfall between 1% and 3% towards the edges.
REFERENCE DOCUMENTS: IFC Drawings VicRoads Spec 703.15
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Capture any changes in design or RFI's as per approved red-line markup procedure
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Ensure that any NCRs pertaining to the lot / element / Work area that this ITP covers, have been closed in CAMs.
The signature below verifies that this ITP has been completed in accordance with the FH’s Quality system Procedures and verifies lot compliance with specifications.

DOT-31608-FUL-QAC-ITP-015 - Electrical and Communications Conduit Installation
template name: DOT-31608-FUL-QAC-ITP-015 - Electrical and Communications Conduit Installation Rev 0

name: ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: IFC Construction Drawings & Most Current Revision.
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Qualified Surveyor to set out extent of works on ground
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: Survey Calibration Certificates
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Identify underground services NDD/hand dig as necessary.
REFERENCE DOCUMENTS: Dial Before You Dig
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Conduit sizing to comply with VR table 733.021
○ Excludes utility providers designs and requirements

ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Unless otherwise specified, materials used for bedding and backfilling shall be uniform in composition and free from perishable matter and shall comply with the requirements specified in Table 706.061.
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Entry/Exit points to be established
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Minimum conduit cover shall apply as per table 733.031
○ Under footpath or unpaved areas (LV Circuits only) – 600mm
○ Under footpath or unpaved areas (Extra LV or Comms conduits only) – 300mm
REFERENCE DOCUMENTS: VR SS 733.031, Refer Individual asset owners specifications
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Once the bedding material has been laid and the conduits put in place, works shall not proceed prior to inspection by superintendent or representative.
○ For Vicroads assets only. Not applicable to Utility providers
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Under Paved Areas - 98% Modified Compaction

○ Unless otherwise specified, pavement material shall have during compaction a uniform moisture content within the range 85% to 115% of the optimum moisture content as determined in the Modified compactive effort.

○ Backfilling beneath areas to be paved shall be assessed for compaction in lots as defined in Section 173. The number of tests per lot shall be three. Backfill, the whole of which passes the 37.5 mm AS sieve, shall be compacted to a mean value of density ratio of not less than 97%. The calculation of density ratio shall be based on Standard compactive effort. A lot shall consist of a single layer of work. A minimum of 20% of all lots constructed shall be tested.
3.5 - Survey pick up / Bore Mark Out
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Survey to pick up as record of conformity on top of laid conduit prior to backfill.
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Ensure clean fills is used to fill in Entry/ Exit points
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Conduit arrangement to suit trench detail;
○ Conduit to slope towards pit for drainage purposes;
○ Quantity of conduits to be confirmed and entered w/ each lot.
REFERENCE DOCUMENTS: Utility Provider Drawings/ Project Plans
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Each conduit for electrical wiring an communications cables shall be provided one synthetic draw cord not less than 3mm diameter and a minimum breaking strain of 1.6kN
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Ensure site is clean and all garbage has been removed

ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: The reinstated surface shall be maintained in a trafficable condition after the completion of backfilling. Additional pavement material shall be placed in the trench and compacted as specified where in paved areas settlement or loss of material from the surface exceeds 20 mm measured from a straight edge laid across the top of the trench.
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Bore Logs of the works to be supplied from subcontractor
The signature below verifies that this ITP has been completed in accordance with the FH’s Quality system Procedures and verifies lot compliance with specifications.
